properties.areaDesc: Fayette, GA; Coweta, GA; Spalding, GA
properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 6 at 11:58PM EST by NWS Peachtree City GA
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City has issued a Flood
Warning for the following rivers in Georgia...

Line Creek near Senoia affecting Coweta...Fayette and Spalding
Counties


.Recent heavy rainfall has caused significant runoff into streams and
rivers which will cause flooding in some areas.

The National Weather Service in Peachtree City has issued a
* Flood Warning for
The Line Creek near Senoia.
* From this evening until further notice.
* At 11PM Thursday the stage was 9.73 feet...and
rising.
* Flood stage is 10 feet.
* At 10 feet...Minor flooding of the natural flood plain begins
which primarily affects agricultural and wooded areas. A small dirt
utility access road near the Georgia Highway 85 bridge goes
underwater.
properties.instruction:
All persons with interests along the river should monitor the latest
forecasts...and be prepared to take necessary precautions to protect
life and property.

The latest stage data was furnished in cooperation with the United
States Geological Survey.
